feed.title: Combined summary - Static addresses on chains encouraging address *RE* use

entry.title: Combined summary - Static addresses on chains encouraging address *RE* use
entry.summary: The context explores the use of a static address privacy system in an alternate blockchain that promotes address re-use and charges higher transaction fees for those seeking privacy. The crux of the discussion is whether this system remains effective if 95% of the transactions re-use addresses, thereby making them effectively static. Jeff Garzik proposes the name 'static address' for the intended use of this system, which receives support from Gregory Maxwell, who believes it may highlight the intended one-use-ness of normal addresses. However, Ben Davenport suggests changing the name 'stealth address' to something more neutral. Despite some political undertones, the group ultimately agrees that 'static address' is the most suitable option.
